text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Five people, including 22-year-old twin sisters, were killed in Laghouat. The attackers also slashed the throat of their dog.
- Algeria on Monday celebrates the 36th anniversary of oil and gas nationalisation.
- Opposition parties question population figures used by the government as basis for the number of constituencies for the upcoming parliamentary elections.
- Air Algerie to resume flights to Paris in April. The Algerian carrier suspended flights to the French capital in 1995 in a security row with the French aviation authorities.
- Security forces kill five "terrorists". Seven people assassinated.
